snippet: A jury in Manhattan awarded punitive damages on top of the $48.3 million given last week for economic losses and pain and suffering.
abstract: Manhattan jury awards $24 million in punitive damages to families of Donald C Leo and Ramadan Kurtaj, workers killed when crane tower collapsed in 2008, raising total damages to more than $96 million; crane' s owner James F Lomma was acquitted of criminal charges stemming from collapse, but was found in civil court to be at fault because he knew part of crane that led to accident was defective.
lead_paragraph: A jury in Manhattan awarded punitive damages on top of the $48.3 million given last week for economic losses and pain and suffering.

headline.main: Jury Awards Another $48 Million to Families of 2008 Crane Collapse Victims
headline.print_headline: $48 Million More Awarded in Crane Collapse
